input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to add a signature in adobe reader?
input_text.Response A: Sure, I’d be happy to help.  To add a signature in Adobe Reader, you’ll first need to download the Adobe Reader software and install it on your computer.  Once you have Adobe Reader installed, you can open a PDF document and click on the “Sign” button in the Adobe Reader menu.  You’ll then be prompted to create a new signature, which you can do by clicking on the “Create New Signature” button.  You can then select the type of signature you want to create, such as a handwritten signature or a digital signature, and enter your name and contact information.  Once you’ve created your signature, you can click on the “Sign” button again to add your signature to the PDF document.
input_text.Response B: Sure, I can give you step-by-step instructions. First, open Adobe Reader and click the “File” menu. Then, click “Options”. On the left side of the window that appears, click the “Signature” tab. In the “Add Signature” field, type the text that you want to appear as your signature. Click “OK” and then “Save” to save your changes.

label_annotations.feedback: Both are very informative and have unique styles or relaying the information, i personally prefer B's step by step guide where as A has a bit more detail.
